blocks.value: Saint Peter, also known as Simon Peter, was one of the Twelve Apostles of Jesus Christ and one of the first leaders of the early Church. He is traditionally counted as the first Bishop of Rome.
A fisherman from Bethsaida, Peter was called by Jesus to be a 'fisher of men'. He was often the spokesman for the apostles and was present at major events like the Transfiguration.
According to tradition, Peter was crucified in Rome under Emperor Nero. He requested to be crucified upside down, as he saw himself unworthy to die in the same manner as Jesus.
